articles.title: Inter-Korean Working-Level Talks Held
articles.content:
Inter-Korean Working-Level Talks Held
 Panmunjom, January 15 (KCNA) -- Working-level talks between the north and the south of Korea for the dispatch of the north side's art troupe were held at the Thongil House in Panmunjom on Monday.
					 Present there were members of the north side's delegation led by Kwon Hyok Bong, department director of the Ministry of Culture, and members of the south side's delegation with Ri U Song, section head of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, as its chief delegate.
					
					 At the talks both sides had a sincere discussion on the practical matters related to the performances by the north side's art troupe to be dispatched to the south side's area with the 23rd Winter Olympics as an occasion and adopted a joint press release.
					
					 According to the release, the north side will dispatch its art troupe comprised of more than 140 members to the south side and give its performances in Kangrung and Seoul. Various technical matters for performances will be smoothly settled through consultation with the south side.
					
					 Reflected in the joint press release is the content that the north side will send a field survey delegation as early as possible and the south side will ensure the safety and convenience of the north side's art troupe to the maximum, and other working matters will be discussed in the way of exchanging documents through Panmunjom liaison channel.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Media Warned against Building up Wrong Public Opinion
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Media Warned against Building up Wrong Public Opinion
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Chol Guk, department director of the Central Committee of the Journalists Union of Korea, issued a commentary titled "Misguided Media May Ruin Big Event" on Monday.
					 The conservative media of south Korea obsessed by the conception of confrontation with the fellow countrymen are misleading the public opinion, while describing the DPRK's proposal and sincere efforts for north-south dialogue as "double-dealing tactics". They even admonished the authorities to be vigilant against "the north's trick to impair the south Korea-U.S. alliance".
					
					 Even novices ignorant of the DPRK called the DPRK's dispatch of a cheer group and artists' group the one "aimed to use the Olympics as a promotion ground" and did not hesitate to say that north-south high-ranking talks are to "evade sanctions".
					
					 Such despicable acts of the conservative media keen on finding out things accusing their fellow countrymen are a deliberate deed of chilling the atmosphere for improved north-south ties welcomed by the world, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Because of the conservative media keen on reeling off all sorts of vituperation against the fellow countrymen even before the north-south relations make a good start to depart from their frozen state, the "peace Olympics" so much advertised by the south Korean authorities may turn into "confrontation Olympics".
					
					 Tongue may bring calamity and miswritten pen may become a sword beheading oneself.
					
					 They should know that they may mess up the great event of the nation should they get on the nerves of the dialogue partner and wag their tongue and writing brush at will.
					
					 If the present situation turns into the freezing state which is not wished for by anyone, the blame will entirely rest with those who made fun of and went against the active proposal and efforts made by the DPRK for the improvement of the north-south ties.
					
					 The south Korean authorities may find the wedding ceremony turning into a mourning ceremony if they fail to hold tight control of media and of their own tongue.

articles.title: Anniversary of Paper Saenal (New Day) Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Paper Saenal (New Day) Marked
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place at the Central Youth Hall Monday to mark the 90th anniversary of the launch of the paper Saenal (New Day) by President Kim Il Sung.
					 Attending it were Choe Hwi, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), and Pak Chol Min, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Youth League.
					
					 Choe Hwi said in his report that in the 1920s Kim Il Sung formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) and organized revolutionary organizations consisting of young people and children and other people from all walks of life and led the work to found the revolutionary paper, well aware of the importance of publications.
					
					 Thanks to his efforts and leadership, the first revolutionary paper whose title is Saenal was founded on Jan. 15, Juche 17 (1928), the reporter noted, adding:
					
					 The President launched a lot of revolutionary publications on the basis of his experience in the founding of Saenal and in this course provided the revolutionary tradition of the Workers' Party of Korea on media.
					
					 The Juche-based tradition was carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The history of publications of the WPK, along with Saenal, is a history of leadership and love of the peerlessly great persons and a proud history in which the publications have served as an ideological weapon ensuring the idea and guidance of the leader and as a treasured sword of revolution giving full play to the mental strength of the army and people.
					
					 The reporter called for adding luster to the honor of being the ideological vanguard and the first death-defying corps of the WPK in the general onward movement for a fresh victory of revolution under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, wielding the writing brush of the revolution.

articles.title: Jagang Provincial Photo Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Jagang Provincial Photo Exhibition Opens
 Kanggye, January 15 (KCNA) -- A Jagang provincial photo exhibition opened with due ceremony in Kanggye City on Monday to mark the 20th anniversary of the creation of the Kanggye Spirit by leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display at the exhibition are a photo of leader Kim Jong Il visiting Jagang Province and pictures showing the exploits of the leader who put forward the workers and other inhabitants in the province as the creators of the Kanggye Spirit and wisely led them.
					
					 There are also photos showing the greatness of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were officials of party and power organs, working people's organizations and industrial establishments and cooperative farms and working people in the province.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony its participants looked round the venue of the exhibition.

articles.title: Art Performance Marks Anniversary of Kanggye Spirit
articles.content:
Art Performance Marks Anniversary of Kanggye Spirit
 Kanggye, January 15 (KCNA) -- Art performance "Kanggye Spirit Will Be Everlasting" was given on Monday to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the creation of the Kanggye spirit by leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The performance began with chorus "The General Is the Banner of Victory".
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers praising the revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Il who visited Jagang Province and made its inhabitants create the spirit of the times so as to open up a new history of a land of bliss.
					
					 Its numbers included narration and music "The Immortal History of Revolutionary Activities in Jagang Province", mixed duet and chorus "We Will Never Forget", female solo "Bright Moon over My Country" and serial songs "Jagang Province Is the One My Country Boasts of".
					
					 There were also numbers representing the local people's revolutionary will to turn the province into a socialist land of bliss and make a dynamic advance in the van of the era as befitting the creators of the Kanggye spirit, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The performance was enjoyed by officials of the party and power organs and working people's organizations, industrial establishments and co-op farms and working people in the province.

articles.title: Thermal Power Plants Boost Production
articles.content:
Thermal Power Plants Boost Production
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Thermal power plants of the DPRK put spurs to electric power production in hearty response to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					 Electric power production by thermal power generation increased 112.8 percent in a little over 10 days from the beginning of the year as compared with the same period of last year.
					
					 The Pukchang Thermal Power Complex operates all generators at full capacity by directing big efforts to equipment management and technical control.
					
					 The Sunchon Thermal Power Plant overfulfills its daily production plan by introducing sci-tech achievements to raise combustion efficiency.
					
					 The Chongchongang and the East Pyongyang thermal power plants are also putting production on a normal basis by dint of self-reliance and self-development.

articles.title: Natural Zeolite Effective for Fruit Farming
articles.content:
Natural Zeolite Effective for Fruit Farming
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Kilju Fruit Farm in the DPRK has achieved success in fruit farming by making effective use of natural zeolite.
					 The natural zeolite, strong in adsorbing nutritive components, contains silicon, magnesium, potassium and other various microelements.
					
					 According to Sin Kwang Sok, chief engineer of the farm, it has improved the growth of fruit trees and raised per-hectare yield by using natural zeolite as feed additive, together with fertilizer, from several years ago.
					
					 The natural zeolite was also used on trial in exterminating blights.
					
					 It shortened the time of killing insects and lowered the rate of disease's outbreak.
					
					 It helps raise water holding capacity of soil, thus ensuring humidity appropriate to fruit production.
					
					 The farm set the production of quality organic fertilizer based on natural zeolite as the goal of this year's first campaign.
					
					 It is scrupulously organizing the work for securing necessary amount of natural zeolite, while giving priority to study of science and technology.

articles.title: Lots of Technical Innovation Proposals Applied in DPRK
articles.content:
Lots of Technical Innovation Proposals Applied in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Members of the April 15 Technical Innovation Shock Brigade at industrial establishments across the country have made tangible contributions to strengthening the independence and Juche character of the national economy and increasing production through the application of at least 34,000 technical innovation proposals over the last one year.
					 They established Juche-oriented production lines and dynamically conducted a mass technical innovation movement.
					
					 Those of the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant contributed to putting the operation of equipment on normal track and shortening the time of repair.
					
					 Officials and members of the shock brigade at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex set up an oxygen-blast furnace of Korean style to maintain the regular production of pig iron relying on anthracite.
					
					 Members of the shock brigade in the sector of coal industry introduced an efficient coal-cutting method and realized the comprehensive mechanization of pit work and diversified transport.
					
					 Those at the Kumsong Tractor Factory carried out the 80 h.p. tractor production task by making necessary jigs, molds and accessories with their own efforts and technology.
					
					 Those at the Pyongyang Trolley Bus Factory modernized tens of machines of scores of species, manufactured a lot of facilities and completed the assembly lines for trolley bus production on a high level.
					
					 Those in the light industrial sector positively helped reenergize the production with valuable scientific and technical achievements and those in agriculture contributed to raising the hot wind of scientific farming.

articles.title: Proactive Proposal for Peaceful Environment on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Proactive Proposal for Peaceful Environment on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The new policy for improving the relations between the north and the south of Korea, set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his historic New Year Address, has enjoyed positive response from the public at home and abroad for its validity and vitality.
					 The proposal on easing the acute military tension between the north and the south and creating a peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula reflects the DPRK's firm will to prevent a war on the Peninsula and defend peace by the concerted efforts of the north and the south under the condition that a powerful war deterrent has been provided to frustrate and contain any nuclear threat from the U.S.
					
					 The present atmosphere for improved north-south relations, provided by our proactive proposal and efforts, showed the world that when the north and the south are determined to do, they can surely improve their frozen relations.
					
					 The U.S. recently took a measure for delaying its joint military maneuvers. This is attributable to our bold measure for north-south dialogue and positive efforts for peace on the Peninsula and the strong demands of the public at home and abroad.
					
					 What is most important in improving the inter-Korean relations is to ease the acute military tension between the north and the south and create a peaceful environment.
					
					 As long as such unstable situation as now which is neither wartime nor peacetime persists, the north and the south cannot sit face to face to have a sincere discussion over the issue of improving the bilateral relations, nor will they advance straight towards the goal of national reunification.
					
					 If the channels of communication between the north and the south remain cutoff and the critical state of military confrontation persists as now, armed conflict may break out any time and anywhere and it may develop into a full-scale war.
					
					 The north and the south should desist from doing anything that might aggravate the situation, and promote dialogue and negotiations at different levels and in various sectors with the aim of removing mutual misunderstanding and distrust and make joint efforts to open the way to national reunification and common prosperity.
					
					 Our nation is not the weak one of the past which was deprived of its sovereignty and subject to ruin and division by outside forces because it lacked strength.
					
					 There is nothing to fear and nothing impossible if the north and the south share one purpose and pool their efforts.
					
					 All the fellow countrymen should fully discharge their obligations and play their role before the times and the nation in response to the proactive proposal of the DPRK for defending peace and security on the Korean Peninsula by the concerted efforts of the nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Trade Union Calls for Reduction of Work Hours
articles.content:
S. Korean Trade Union Calls for Reduction of Work Hours
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Medical Solidarity Headquarters of Public Transport Trade Union held a press conference in front of the Seoul City Office on January 10, calling for the reduction of the workers' labor hours, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye.
					 Speakers said that hospitals have increased the working hours under the pretext of the personnel shortage, adding that such situation would get worse.
					
					 They deplored that such practices not only drive workers into death but lead to accidents to threaten even the lives of citizens.
					
					 They stressed that the Seoul City authorities should stop encouraging workers' overtime work.

articles.title: Repeal of Evil Law Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of Evil Law Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held the 1153rd Thursday rally in Seoul on Jan. 11, demanding the repeal of "Security Law" and the release of prisoners of conscience, according to the south Korean internet paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Stating that the people cannot enjoy the sound happiness and democracy as long as the prisoners of conscience are behind bars, speakers at the rally urged the "president" to set them free as soon as possible.

articles.title: S. Korea: Youth Unemployment Rate Reaches All-time High in 2017
articles.content:
S. Korea: Youth Unemployment Rate Reaches All-time High in 2017
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Kyunghyang Daily News on Jan. 11 carried an editorial deploring the high youth unemployment rate in 2017.
					 The jobless rate among young people under 29 in 2017 reached all-time high since the year 2000, the editorial said, adding that under the present "government" there is nothing changed.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Meet
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Meet
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) held a meeting at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Jan. 12 to vow to implement the tasks set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address for Juche 107 (2018) and his New Year message.
					 Attending it were Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, advisers and department directors of the Chongryon Central Committee, the director of the Research Institute on History of Korean Residents in Japan, chairmen of Chongryon headquarters in Kanto, leading officials of Chongryon organizations and businesses, officials under Chongryon headquarters in Kanto and teachers of Korean schools at all levels.
					
					 Read out at the meeting was Kim Jong Un's New Year message to the chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee.
					
					 Making a report, Ho Jong Man said that the Supreme Leader's New Year Address is a treasured sword of sure victory as it advanced the outstanding strategy, tasks and radical proposals for winning in the final showdown with the U.S. when the Juche cause is in its new higher stage, and it is a militant banner encouraging the army and people in the homeland to a revolutionary general offensive.
					
					 He stressed the need for Chongryon officials to take the lead in fully displaying the true nature of Chongryon, a dignified overseas citizens organization of the DPRK, and setting up a new milestone on the sacred road for strengthening the movement of Koreans in Japan this year.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was read out.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Introduced in Nepal
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Nepalese newspaper Arpan carried the full text of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Cause of the Great Party of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Is Ever-Victorious" on December 29 last year.
					 The work, published on October 4, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies that the seven decades-long history of the Workers' Party of Korea is the one of victory which demonstrated the validity and invincibility of the cause of the party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. It also stresses that the cause of the party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is invincible.
					
					 The newspaper carried a photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Bulgaria
Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association carried the detailed gist of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address in its bulletin on January 6.

articles.title: Career and Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Reported by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Career and Exploits of Kim Jong Suk Reported by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign media reported about the revolutionary career and exploits of the anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk, a woman commander of Mt Paektu, between Dec. 20 and 22 last year to mark the centenary of her birth.
					 The Indian newspaper Indian and World Event said:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk was born into a poor peasant family in Hoeryong, North Hamgyong Province of Korea, on Dec. 24, 1917.
					
					 She keenly experienced the grief of being a member of the stateless nation and embarked upon the road of liberating the country in her teens, and grew up to be a committed revolutionary through her underground struggle and activities in the guerilla zone.
					
					 She joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung and had waged protracted bloody battles with arms until the liberation of the country, winning her fame as the anti-Japanese war woman commander and a competent political activist.
					
					 The Egyptian newspaper Al Akhbar Almassay said:
					
					 History recorded many famous women who contributed to progress and prosperity of their countries and nations but there was no such woman political activist as Kim Jong Suk who dedicated her all to the freedom and happiness of the people.
					
					 What was outstanding of her exploits for the cause of national liberation is that she protected Kim Il Sung at the risk of her life.
					
					 Cambodia's AKP and National Radio and Guinea's domestic, international and seven national languages broadcasting services dealt in detail with her noble career and exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Personages of different countries issued statements on Jan. 4 and 5 in support of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address.
					 Benigno Gonzales Villasana, chairman of the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association, said that Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address declared that the great, historic cause of perfecting the national nuclear forces was accomplished.
					
					 At last, the DPRK emerged a world-level nuclear power and it is clear that the U.S. can not dare to ignite a war against the DPRK, he noted.
					
					 He said Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address set forth the tasks for socialist economic construction.
					
					 He noted that Kim Jong Un also made proposals for mending the north-south relations, which are enjoying full support and welcome from the world peace-loving progressive peoples.
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Romania, expressed the full support for the New Year Address of Kim Jong Un, the Supreme Leader of the Korean people, stressing:
					
					 We urge the U.S. to do things helpful to the settlement of affairs on the Korean Peninsula, far from its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 We will always support the struggle of the independent and peace-loving Korean people.
					
					 Abdi Kedir, chief of the Ethiopian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said the proposals for national reunification advanced by Kim Jong Un are the most just and realistic ones, adding that the progressive humankind wants Korea's independent reunification.

articles.title: World Media Praise Kim Jong Un as Ideal State Leader
articles.content:
World Media Praise Kim Jong Un as Ideal State Leader
 Pyongyang, January 15 (KCNA) -- Media of the United States and other countries have praised respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's outstanding personality at a time when his historic New Year Address evokes a lively response worldwide.
					 Many media of the world are lavishing praises on him as a popular statesman with warm tenderness, the leader remarkably increasing the strength of the DPRK and the young leader who put the U.S. on the defensive through successive blows, despising it.
					
					 The U.S. internet news NK NEWS and magazine Newsweek said the New Year Address of Kim Jong Un was full of confidence and that he is respected and revered by the people.
					
					 The Indian paper Ocean News Point, the Iranian Ilna and other media praised him as the most ideal state leader in the present times with good character and qualifications, a popular statesman with noble benevolence and outlook on the people and a leader strong in faith, guts and independent stand.
					
					 The East Siberian Publishing House in Irkutsk Region, Russia in a special article posted on its internet homepage said he is the youngest state leader in the present world, adding:
					
					 The character of leader Kim Jong Un draws attention of the international community.
					
					 His quality is to do everything at a go and with a blitz.
					
					 His spirit "At a go" is not merely the youthful strength and enthusiasm and a graph of acceleration, but the spirit of brave charge--doing ten years' work in one year, regardless of ready-made formulas and theories.
					
					 His spirit is the spirit of successive offensive, not remaining complacent with successes.
					
					 The DPRK, which has already emerged a politico-ideological power and military power, is advancing to be a sci-tech power, economic power, civilized power and sports power. From this the international community highly admires the spirit of successive offensive of leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He has super-powerful spirit jolting the world.
					
					 Patrioti Moskva, DPRK Today and other internet homepages of Russia and its internet magazine Lemchich said that the successes of great leap of the DPRK in the building of a powerful socialist country in 2017 proved that no force could block the Korean army and people advancing by dint of self-reliance and self-development, united close around Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper The Daily Folk said: The DPRK has already emerged a world-level military power equipped with latest strategic means and H-bomb. Promising is the future of the DPRK which will advance into the world arena as a richer and more powerful entity under the guidance of Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Witnessing the world-starling events in the DPRK and the situation of the Korean Peninsula in recent years, the world came to clearly know that the steady victories of the DPRK are ascribable to its great leader and believes that the DPRK will emerge victorious for all ages.
					
					 High is the spirit of the Korean people vigorously advancing toward fresh victories, rallied close around the great leader who is deeply revered by the whole world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kim Kwang Suk
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Kim Kwang Suk
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un envio el dia 14 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de difunta Actora del Pueblo Kim Kwang Suk, profesora directora de musica vocal del Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Pyongyang, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Tienen lugar conversaciones de trabajo Norte-Sur sobre envio de grupo artistico
articles.content:
Tienen lugar conversaciones de trabajo Norte-Sur sobre envio de grupo artistico
Phanmunjom, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 15 en el Pabellon Thong-il de Phanmunjom las conversaciones de trabajo Norte-Sur de Corea sobre el envio del grupo artistico del Norte de Corea al Sur de Corea.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion encabezada por Kwon Hyok Bong, jefe de departamento del Ministerio de Cultura, por la parte nortena y por la surena, los miembros de la delegacion presidida por el delegado-jefe Ri U Song, jefe de seccion del Ministerio de Cultura, Deporte y Turismo.
					
					Ambas partes discutieron sinceramente los problemas practicos relacionado con el aseguramiento de la funcion del grupo artistico de la parte nortena a enviarse a la parte surena en ocasion de los 23o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales y aprobaron un comunicado conjunto.
					
					La parte nortena enviara el grupo artistico compuesto por mas de 140 miembros de la Orquesta Samjiyon, que ofrecera su funcion en Kangrung y Seul, senala el comunicado y continua:
					
					Se resolveran satisfactoriamente, luego de consultar con la parte surena, los problemas practicos para el aseguramiento de la funcion.
					
					Para el fin, la parte nortena despachara en un futuro no lejano una delegacion de estudio y la parte surena facilitara al maximo la seguridad fisica y la comodidad del grupo artistico de la parte nortena. Y otros problemas se deliberaran a modo de intercambio de documentos por la via de enlace de Phanmunjom.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae recorre varias unidades de la ciudad de Sinuiju
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae recorre varias unidades de la ciudad de Sinuiju
Sinuiju, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del Comite Central del PTC, dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Cosmeticos de Sinuiju y la Granja Cooperativa de Sokha de la ciudad de Sinuiju.
					Recorriendo varios lugares de la Fabrica de Cosmeticos de Sinuiju, el estimulo la lucha abnegada de los obreros y subrayo la necesidad de transformar los procesos de produccion en los economicos para asegurar en alto nivel la calidad y cantidad de los articulos.
					
					Acto seguido, Choe visito la Granja Cooperativa de Sokha de la ciudad de Sinuiju, que cambio su fisonomia como el campo modernizado socialista.
					
					Alli apunto que los trabajadores de la Granja deben hacer de manera cientifica y tecnica las faenas agricolas, inolvidando las benevolencias del partido, y sobrepasar el plan estatal de la produccion cerealera del presente ano, e insistio en la necesidad de dinamizar la campana para alcanzar, aprender e intercambiar las experiencias.

articles.title: Kim Chol Guk acusa a medios surcoreanos de crear la erronea opinion publica
articles.content:
Kim Chol Guk acusa a medios surcoreanos de crear la erronea opinion publica
Pyongyang, 15 de enero (ACNC) -- El jefe de departamento del Comite Central de la Union de Periodistas de Corea, Kim Chol Guk, publico el dia 15 un comentario intitulado "La erronea opinion publica puede estropear los eventos de la nacion".
					 Los medios conservadores de prensa surcoreana, penetrados de la concepcion fratricida, inducen en error la opinion publica describiendo la propuesta y los esfuerzos sinceros de la RPDC por el dialogo Norte-Sur como la "tactica de dos caras: paz y guerra", comienza el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					 Para colmo, se atreven a instruir a las autoridades a tomar precaucion de las "tentativas del Norte de meter cunas en la alianza Sudcorea-EE.UU.".
					
					  Por otra parte, los locutores novatos, que no conocen ni jota de la RPDC, transmiten desde la manana hasta la noche las blasfemias de que el envio de los grupos de hinchas y artistas del Norte a los juegos olimpicos invernales es "para utilizar este evento como espacio de propaganda al interior y exterior". Y chismean sin vacilacion alguna que las conversaciones de alto nivel entre ambas partes coreanas son "para evitar la sancion contra el Norte".
					
					  La conducta bochornosa de los medios conservadores surcoreanos, que publican a porfia los articulos insultantes a la parte connacional, deviene la locura intencional que envenena el actual ambiente de las relaciones N-S que complace a todo el mundo.
					
					  Por culpa de ellos que se dedican a injuriar a la RPDC antes de que tengan buena partida las relaciones N-S que se encontraban en congelamiento, es posible que los "Juegos Olimpicos de Paz", anunciados tanto por las autoridades surcoreanas, se conviertan en los "de enfrentamiento".
					
					  La mala lengua busca desgracias y la pluma de blasfemia causa la autodestruccion.
					
					  Dichos medios deben conocer que pueden llevar al fracaso los eventos nacionales si hieren a la contraparte con reportajes y articulos malintencionados actuando sin saber como se ha preparado el actual ambiente de las relaciones N-S.
					
					  Si la actual fase de la situacion da un giro brusco al congelamiento que no desea nadie, la responsabilidad recaera totalmente sobre los tipejos que se burlaron y desafiaron a la propuesta y esfuerzos activos de la RPDC por la mejora de las relaciones N-S.
					
					  Si las autoridades surcoreanas no logran controlar bien los medios de prensa, la fiesta podria convertirse en los funerales.
